video.title: TEDTalks: Life Lessons & Confessions
video.synopsis: Tales of the heart and confessions from the soul are packed with ideas that help set us free. Get inspired by these extraordinary stories.

episodes.synopsis: Chimamanda Adichie tells how she found her authentic cultural voice and warns that if we hear only a single story we risk a critical misunderstanding.
episodes.title: Chimamanda Adichie: The Danger of a Single Story

episodes.synopsis: Elif Shafak builds on the simple idea that listening to stories will not only widen our imaginations, but also help us overcome identity politics.
episodes.title: Elif Shafak: The Politics of Fiction

episodes.synopsis: Chris Abani shares stories of people and "ubuntu," the idea that the only way for me to be human is for you to reflect my humanity back at me.
episodes.title: Chris Abani Muses on Humanity

episodes.synopsis: Author and academic Ben Dunlap tells the story of Sandor Teszler, a Holocaust survivor who taught him about passionate living and lifelong learning.
episodes.title: Ben Dunlap Talks About a Passionate Life

episodes.synopsis: Surgeon Sherwin Nuland discusses the development of electroshock therapy as a cure for severe, life-threatening depression -- including his own.
episodes.title: Sherwin Nuland on Electroshock Therapy

episodes.synopsis: Ad man Rory Sutherland claims that a change in perceived value can be just as satisfying as "real" value, even when applied to real life.
episodes.title: Rory Sutherland: Life Lessons from an Ad Man

episodes.synopsis: Actor Anna Deavere Smith gives life to four American characters: author Studs Terkel, convict Paulette Jenkins, a Korean shopkeeper and a bull rider.
episodes.title: Anna Deavere Smith: Four American Characters

episodes.synopsis: Doris Kearns Goodwin talks about what we can learn from American presidents and shares a moving memory of her own father, and their love of baseball.
episodes.title: Doris Kearns Goodwin on Learning for Past Presidents

episodes.synopsis: Becky Blanton planned to live in her van and see the country, but when her job ended, she explains how her trip turned into a year of being homeless.
episodes.title: Becky Blanton: The Year I Was Homeless

episodes.synopsis: Runner Aimee Mullins redefines the word "disabled" and defies its negative associations, showing how adversity can open the door for human potential.
episodes.title: Aimee Mullins: The Opportunity of Adversity

episodes.synopsis: Playwright Eve Ensler talks about her lifelong disconnection from her body and how two events helped her connect to the physicality of being human.
episodes.title: Eve Ensler: Suddenly, My Body

episodes.synopsis: Storyteller Carmen Agra Deedy spins a funny, wise and luminous tale of parents and kids, starring her Cuban mother. Enjoy the ride -- Mama's driving!
episodes.title: Carmen Agra Deedy Spins Stories

episodes.synopsis: Bipolar comedian Joshua Walters gives a funny and thought-provoking talk on how to walk the line between mental illness and mental "skillness."
episodes.title: Joshua Walters: On Being Just Crazy Enough

episodes.synopsis: Every doctor makes mistakes. But even in medicine's culture of denial, physician Brian Goldman calls on doctors to start talking about being wrong.
episodes.title: Brian Goldman: Doctors Make Mistakes. Can We Talk About That?

episodes.synopsis: Monica Lewinsky draws on her own experiences with public shaming to discuss how the online culture of humiliation can turn deadly.
episodes.title: Monica Lewinsky: The Price of Shame

episodes.synopsis: Twenty years after a devastating bus accident left him a hemiplegic, Joshua Prager searches for the driver who turned his world upside down.
episodes.title: Joshua Prager: In Search of the Man Who Broke My Neck

episodes.synopsis: Mentor and writer Shaka Senghor reveals how serving a prison sentence for second-degree murder put him on a years-long journey to redemption.
episodes.title: Shaka Senghor: Why Your Worst Deeds Don’t Define You

episodes.synopsis: StoryCorps has evolved into the single largest collection of human voices ever recorded. Creator Dave Isay shares his vision for its future.
episodes.title: Dave Isay: Everyone Around You Has a Story the World Needs to Hear

episodes.synopsis: Dame Stephanie Shirley, who founded an all-woman software company in the 1960s, discusses how she upended the expectations of the time.
episodes.title: Dame Stephanie Shirley: Why Do Ambitious Women Have Flat Heads?

episodes.synopsis: Comedian and activist Kevin Breel speaks about his experiences with depression and offers advice for young people coping with mental health issues.
episodes.title: Kevin Breel: Confessions of a Depressed Comic

episodes.synopsis: TED staff member Lisa Bu shares her unique approach to reading in this personal talk about the magic of books.
episodes.title: Lisa Bu: How Books Can Open Your Mind

episodes.synopsis: George Takei reflects on how living in an internment camp during World War II shaped his surprising, personal definition of patriotism and democracy.
episodes.title: George Takei: Why I Love a Country That Once Betrayed Me

episodes.synopsis: Human resources activist Morgana Bailey shares some very personal information to open up a discussion on how we fear judgment -- and judge ourselves.
episodes.title: Morgana Bailey: The Danger of Hiding Who You Are
